This question requires basic knowledge about chemical changes. A chemical change involves a substance reacting with another substance to create new substances with different properties. In option (B), when the meat is submerged in lemon juice, the acid in the lemon juice reacts with the proteins in the meat, causing the meat to break down and become tender. This is a chemical change because new substances are formed. 

Option (A) is a physical change because the paper and marbles are still made of the same materials, they are just rearranged. Option (C) is also a physical change because the blade of grass and sand are still made of the same materials, they are just mixed together. Option (D) is also a physical change because the cotton and water are still made of the same materials, they are just mixed together.

This question requires knowledge of chemical changes and reactions. A chemical change occurs when new substances are formed as a result of a reaction. In option (B), the acid in the lemon juice reacts with the proteins in the meat, resulting in the breaking down or denaturation of the proteins. This is a chemical change. 

Option (A), a piece of paper in marbles, does not involve any chemical reaction. The paper and marbles remain as separate substances and there is no change in their composition. Option (C), a blade of grass in sand, also does not involve a chemical change. The grass and sand remain as separate substances with no change in their composition. Option (D), a piece of cotton in water, does not result in a chemical change either. The cotton and water remain separate, with no new substances formed.

This question requires a knowledge of chemical changes. A chemical change is a process that results in the formation of new substances with different properties. Option (B) is the correct answer because when meat is submerged in lemon juice, the acid in the lemon juice reacts with the proteins in the meat, causing it to break down and become denatured. This is a chemical change. 
Option (A) is incorrect because placing a piece of paper in marbles does not result in any chemical reactions. 
Option (C) is incorrect because a blade of grass in sand does not result in any chemical reactions. 
Option (D) is incorrect because when a piece of cotton is placed in water, it does not undergo any chemical changes.

Option (A) is incorrect because placing paper in marbles would not involve a chemical reaction. Option (C) is incorrect because a blade of grass in sand does not involve a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because placing a piece of cotton in water does not result in a chemical change, only a physical change as the cotton absorbs the water.

In option (B), the piece of meat submerged in lemon juice is likely to result in a chemical change. Lemon juice contains citric acid, which can break down the proteins in the meat, causing it to soften and change its texture. This is a chemical reaction. 

Options (A), (C), and (D) do not involve substances that would likely undergo a chemical change. In option (A), a piece of paper in marbles, the paper and the marbles would remain the same and not undergo any chemical reactions. In option (C), a blade of grass in sand, the grass and the sand would also remain the same and not undergo any chemical reactions. In option (D), a piece of cotton in water, the cotton would absorb water, but this is a physical change and not a chemical change.

This is a chemical change.

Option (D) is incorrect because when a piece of cotton is placed in water, it undergoes a physical change (absorbing the water), but no new substances are formed.

This question tests our understanding of chemical changes and reactions. A chemical change results in the formation of a new substance with different properties. Option (B) is the correct answer because when a piece of meat is submerged in lemon juice, a chemical reaction occurs. The acid in the lemon juice breaks down the proteins in the meat, altering its composition and resulting in a change in texture and taste. This question tests knowledge of chemical changes and reactions. A chemical change occurs when the substances involved undergo a chemical reaction and form new substances with different properties. Option (B) is likely to result in a chemical change because when meat is submerged in lemon juice, the acid in the lemon juice breaks down the proteins in the meat, causing it to change color and texture. Option (A) is incorrect because placing a piece of paper in marbles does not involve a chemical reaction, it is just a physical change. In order to answer this question, we need to understand the difference between a physical change and a chemical change. A physical change involves a change in appearance or state of matter, but the substance itself remains the same. A chemical change, on the other hand, involves a new substance being formed.

Option (B) "a piece of meat submerged in lemon juice" is likely to result in a chemical change. When meat is submerged in lemon juice, the acidic nature of the juice can break down the proteins in the meat. This chemical reaction leads to a change in the composition of the meat, resulting in a tenderizing effect.

Option (A) "a piece of paper in marbles" is an example of a physical change. The paper may become crumpled or wrinkled, but the chemical composition of the paper remains the same.

Option (C) "a blade of grass in sand" is also an example of a physical change. The blade of grass may become buried or bent, but the chemical composition of the grass does not change.

Option (D) "a piece of cotton in water" is another example of a physical change. The cotton may absorb the water and appear wet, but the chemical composition of the cotton remains the same.

Therefore, the most likely result of a chemical change is option (B) "a piece of meat submerged in lemon juice".

This question requires understanding the concept of chemical changes and how they differ from physical changes. A chemical change occurs when the composition of a substance is altered, resulting in the formation of new substances with different properties. In option (B), when a piece of meat is submerged in lemon juice, the acid in the lemon juice breaks down the proteins in the meat, resulting in a chemical change. Options (A), (C), and (D) all involve physical changes, where the appearance or state of the substances may change, but their composition remains the same.
